newsitem.title: USA: Ashland refinery Friday causes minor damage.
newsitem.headline: Ashland refinery Friday causes minor damage.

text.p: A fire Friday in the sewer system at Ashland's St Paul Park, Minnesota, refinery caused minor damage to a unit that remained under repair on Monday, a company spokesman said.

The official would not say what the impact on output at the 70,000-barrel-per-day plant was, though a state environmental official said the problem appeared to be with one of the crude unit heaters after what local news reports called an explosion at the facility.
"There was a fire in the sewer system and it caused minor damage to a unit. The unit is currently under repair," said Ashland spokesman Chuck Rice.
Rice said the fire broke out at noon, was immediately doused but then reignited, injuring four Ashland refinery fire fighters.
The fire burned itself out at around 6:00 p.m Friday, Rice said.
Two of the four injured fire fighters suffered severe facial burns and remained hospitalized Monday. ((New York Energy Desk 1212 859-1631))
